title: Exploratory Learning Fundamentals
summary: Exploratory learning encourages learners to investigate open-ended problems, collect evidence, and iteratively refine their understanding.
content: Exploratory learning emphasises curiosity-driven inquiry. Learners form hypotheses, test ideas with lightweight experiments, and reflect on findings to build durable knowledge structures.

title: Project-Based Learning Workflow
summary: Project-based learning organises complex challenges into phases of scoping, building, and reflection supported by collaborative feedback.
content: A project-based learning workflow begins with defining authentic problems. Teams prototype artefacts, gather peer critique, and use reflections to consolidate skills that transfer to new contexts.

title: Knowledge Gap Diagnostics
summary: Diagnostic questioning surfaces misconceptions by comparing learner responses with high-signal reference material.
content: Effective diagnostic instruments combine conceptual and application questions. Responses are evaluated for coverage of critical ideas, enabling targeted interventions that close observed gaps.

title: Spaced Repetition Patterns
summary: Spaced repetition schedules revisit material with expanding intervals to maximise retention and minimise forgetting.
content: Spacing learning sessions leverages the forgetting curve. By increasing intervals after successful retrieval, learners reinforce durable memories while prioritising topics that require additional review.
